body.header: Relative clauses can be used to make one sentence from two. In each case below, complete the sentence by adding the relative pronoun.

section.p: 1.The water-balanced railway's hydraulic brake helps store energy to pump water. Its main function is to slow the train. The water-balanced railway's hydraulic brake main function is to slow the train, helps store energy to pump water.
2.A solar cell is a power source. It converts sunlight into electricity.A solar cell is a power source converts sunlight into electricity.
3.A hydram is powered by water pressure. It can irrigate fields 60 metres above the water source.A hydram, can irrigate fields sixty metres above the water source, is powered by water pressure.

4.The water-balanced railway is an example of sustainable technology. It is powered by the force of gravity.The water-balanced railway, is powered by the force of gravity, is an example of sustainable technology.

5.Ecologists are scientists. They study the relationship between living organisms and their environment.Ecologists are scientists study the relationship between living organisms and their environment.
6.Greenpeace is an organisation. Its aim is to protect wildlife and the natural environment.Greenpeace is an organisation aim is to protect wildlife and the natural environment.

body.section: When describing an object we often use relative clauses to give information about its function, construction and so on. These may be defining relative clauses, for example: A ballast tank is a tank which holds water for weight. The relative clause gives essential information about the object, so it is a defining relative clause. Or they may be non-defining relative clauses, for example: The carriages, which can carry up to 20 passengers, go up and down a steep slope. The relative clause gives additional information about the object, so it is a non-defining relative clause. Only non-defining relative clauses need to be enclosed in commas.
